segments.text: I think the woman is in her own little world, drying that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and she’s just standing in it like it’s normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so close to falling, but he’s too busy grabbing cookies to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is just waiting, so excited for her treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and the floor is so slippery—this is an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman doesn’t even seem to hear the water or see the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is a disaster, but she’s just standing there, calm as ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware she is of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the water is just going to keep pouring.
segments.speaker: PAR
